topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a00ef3636872280300017a#post_55a00ef3636872280300017a
I posted about this a couple days ago, but it's actually likely that porn will drive the development of VR.

The problem currently with the development of VR is that facebook and that are pissing away their money thinking people want to use VR for school or that and they're pissing away their money in metaphorical territory wars with other competitors.

In the short run what is probably going to happen is that VR is going to financially fail cause when the oculus comes out there's going to be very few games with native support and it's going to cost $250.  Right now there's only about 50 games that offer oculus support.  Remember when the WiiU launched with not a lot of games?


Meanwhile the porn industry doesn't give a fuck about other porn companies making porn games and are actually working together to develop support together.  They don't have a lot of money, but they're not pissing away their money.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a011b86368727a690001f4#post_55a011b86368727a690001f4
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a010ef636872024d00066b#post_55a010ef636872024d00066b
I imagine it will turn into a more niche market. Video games (FPSes and the like) and porn. especially the porn
[/bq]
I think it's not going to be a niche market; I do think in the long run it's going to sell incredibly well, but chances are it's going to have a incredibly poor launch.  It's probably going to take years until VR starts selling well and it's probably going to be a decade until widespread adoption.

To put it another way: don't launch a $250 gaming device with support for only a couple dozen games.
